extendedIngredients.name: canned black-eyed peas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained

extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) fire-roasted diced tomatoes, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: polish sausage
extendedIngredients.originalString: 14 ounces Johnsonville® Polish Kielbasa Sausage, sliced

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken thighs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.title: Big Easy Jambalaya

winePairing.pairingText: Jambalayan on the menu? Try pairing with Albarino, rosé Wine, and Sauvignon Blanc. These low-tannin, lower alcohol wines will complement the heat in spicy cajun dishes, instead of making your mouth burn more. The La Canan Albarino with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: La Cana Albarino
productMatches.description: Pineapple, lemon, seashell and salt scents carry through on the pure, silky palate. Finishes very long with brilliant acidity, rich citrus fruit flavors, fine minerals and just the slightest touch of almond. Absolutely delicious.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine all ingredients except rice. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or until chicken is tender.                                                                                           Stir in rice. Cook on high 30 minutes longer or until rice is tender.                                        Yield: 8 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Big Easy Jambalaya in  Taste of Home’s Ultimate Potluck Recipe Contest                                                                                                                                                                                                Nutritional Facts                                                                             1-1/2 cups equals 565 calories, 23 g fat (8 g saturated fat), 108 mg cholesterol, 1,673 mg sodium, 56 g carbohydrate, 3 g fiber, 33 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine all ingredients except rice. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or until chicken is tender.
Stir in rice. Cook on high 30 minutes longer or until rice is tender.
